text: August unemployment rates ranged from 4.0% in Nebraska to 13.2% in Nevada.
Compared with a year prior, Q2 2020 GDP declines ranged from 4.6% in UT to 13.9% in HI.
Unemployment in PA fell from its April peak but was higher than during the Great Recession.
New York’s real GDP from manufacturing dropped to a 15-year low in Q2 2020.
All 50 states and DC saw a year-over-year increase in house prices from Q2 2019 to Q2 2020.
SC’s Q2 2020 GDP from accommodation and food services was half of what it was in Q2 2019.
In August, average private-sector weekly earnings ranged from $787 (MS) to $1,869 (DC).
Ohio’s state and local public jobs fell nearly 10% from August 2019 to August 2020.
Hawaii had 52% fewer leisure and hospitality jobs in August 2020 than in August 2019.
Retail employment was higher in August 2020 than in August 2019 in only 14 states.
Washington’s annual house price growth has exceeded the US average each quarter since 2014.
